definition[0]: to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another
example[0]: We finally opted for the wood finish.
example[1]: Many young people are opting to go on to college.
definition[1]: to choose one thing rather than another
example[2]: Faced with voluntary redundancy, nearly half the managers opted instead for early retirement.
example[3]: The airline opted against a cut in fares because such a move is almost always matched quickly by rivals.
example[4]: Policyholders opting to get out early would be entitled to about 48 cents on the dollar.
